  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 6th during the loading process it was discovered that the package was leaking. The package was marked as ID8000 Consumer Commodity, 9 and contained five bottles of perfume, four of which were broken. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024090537
item.description:
Report X-2024090537

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The external overpack marked box was dented on the sides and two edges when it was discovered. The flaps on the underside of the box, were loose, as the water activated tape that was supposed to secure them shut was frayed. When the box was inspected , the granules were visible at the bottom interior of the box. The lid of the inner plastic pail had a divot gouged on the edge circumference.

item.title: Report E-2024090081
item.description:
Report E-2024090081

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-03
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 0.5-gallon of UN1263 "High Build Epoxy White" released from a 1-gallon metal pail caused by improper loading and impacted the trailer floor. The terminal personnel had already cleaned the released material. The recovered material, cardboard, and spent oil dri was placed into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum for disposal.
